summary: The diff adds a new Bitcoin mining dashboard UI (shell/header/dashboard/settings/payouts) and related React Query hooks, plus mining-themed styling tokens. However, there are gaps around the required generated image assets, payout flow (custom address on request), and remaining heart/Valentine-adjacent wording in the UI footer.

missing_requirements.requirement: Payout request uses the currently saved payout address by default and allows changing it before submitting.
missing_requirements.reason: The UI lets the user type an optional address, but the payout mutation only submits an amount (no address). This prevents actually requesting a payout to a changed address.

missing_requirements.requirement: Include new custom static image assets under frontend/public/assets/generated (hero bg, icon sheet, mining rig illustration) and render them from the frontend; update UI to use new assets.
missing_requirements.reason: The UI references only the hero background image path, but the diff summary does not show the required assets being added under frontend/public/assets/generated, nor any references to the required icon sheet and mining rig illustration.

missing_requirements.requirement: Remove Valentine/hearts/romantic proposal language and CTAs from the primary app flow.
missing_requirements.reason: The unauthenticated and authenticated shells include a footer line with a heart symbol ("Built with ❤️"), which conflicts with the requirement to remove hearts/romance styling/copy from the primary flow.

hallucinated_features.description: Profile setup modal requiring the user to enter a name before accessing the mining features.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not ask for a mandatory profile creation step; it only specifies mining dashboard/settings/payouts functionality for signed-in users.

hallucinated_features.description: Caffeine.ai promotional footer/link added to the main app shell.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not request adding product attribution or outbound promotional links in the user-facing UI.
